text: This is a theme module already coded and  editing it in DND. The whole point is to quickly convert the DND changes to drop the module in a new template, not to have to modify the code. It works on all the other modules (I've only  run into it one other time)
Hey there! I am new here and I am facing a problem with a iterating over a table items inside Power theme's template. could someone point my mistakes here :slightly_smiling_face:
what are your mistakes? What are you expecting to see that you aren’t?

in the design manager view,

Are you expecting the first object in the boxes array to actually read `cats: "some cat name"` vs row.category?

If so, in your macro you need to put `{{ row.category }}`

semi related — I’d set up that macro to take in a hubdb table id so that it is reusable

`build_box_from_table(tableId)` and then use that tableId var inside your macro

<@U25PYL3Q8> So I am trying to map table elements to a Power section Image boxes. If I add the whole section in a for in loop, it render each table element in a new section like in the photo. so my goal is to do a macro that goes through all boxes .

gotcha…well, I guess I don’t though — I am not sure what you are asking assistance with. I see screenshots and I’m sure there is some connection I’m missing here about what you need help with — apologies for not understanding
hopefully Ergun understands a bit more about what you are asking
Hi <@U03SX72J83D>, nice to see that you guys are using POWER. We have quite a neat solution for your use-case. I will DM you
<@U03AKL6Q1B2> I've had this too. It seems to only happen when the modules are part of the original template. If you delete it and re add it, that fixed it for me.
Thanks <@UATE4ATHP> appreciate the help, I will try that!
